description: [AAI] The Africa-America Institute (AAI) announces that President and CEO Kofi Appenteng will be stepping down from his position effective July 1, 2025. Kofi has served AAI with distinction for over 25 years, serving as President and CEO for nearly ten years of that time. Under his leadership, AAI has deepened its impact, programs, and community bridging Africa and its diaspora to catalyze a more sustainable and equitable world.
title: Africa: The Africa-America Institute Announces CEO Transition

description: [State Department] From June 22-25, more than 2,700 U.S. and African public and private sector leaders gathered for the 17th U.S.-Africa Business Summit, hosted by the Corporate Council on Africa and the President of Angola.  This year's Summit marked a record turnout, including 12 African Heads of State.
title: Africa: Record-Breaking U.S.-Africa Business Summit Yields $2.5 Billion in Deals and Commitments  - Fact Sheet

description: [Premium Times] Mr Janabi was elected in May 2025 during a special session of the WHO Regional Committee for Africa held in Geneva
title: Africa: Mohammed Janabi Formally Assumes Office As Who Africa Regional Director

description: [CAF] The stage is set for yet another unforgettable edition of the TotalEnergies CAF African Nations Championship (CHAN) 2024, as Kenya, Tanzania, and Uganda prepare to jointly host the tournament for the first time in history.
title: Africa: TotalEnergies CAF CHAN 2024 - Groups and Fixtures Analysed Group-By-Group

description: [African Union] The Chairperson of the African Union Commission, H.E. Mahmoud Ali Youssouf, extends his warmest congratulations to the Government and people of the Federal Republic of Somalia on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of their independence.
title: Africa: Somalia Independence Day Message From the Chairperson of the African Union Commission

description: [Mastercard Foundation] Across Africa, some of the most resilient and effective entrepreneurs are displaced women. With forced displacement at an all-time high and economies under pressure to grow inclusively, the case for investing in displaced women has never been more urgent.
title: Africa: The Investment Case for Africa's Displaced Women Entrepreneurs

description: [Ethiopian Herald] Ethiopia's rich cultural diversity and heritage are cornerstones of its global identity and historical significance. Also, its natural endowments attract visitors and scientists that look for ways and means of preserving them. However, preserving and managing this invaluable heritage requires sophisticated and meticulous planning and programming of activities focused on natural resources preservation. These efforts require collaboration at national, regional and global levels.
title: Africa: Ethiopia's Role in Promoting Cultural Diplomacy, Heritage Preservation in Africa

description: [ISS] ISWAP's hunt for resources is eroding the ability of communities in northern Cameroon to withstand economic hardship.
title: Africa: Lake Chad Basin Governments Should Redouble Efforts Against Iswap

description: [Global Fund] Geneva -- Suriname has officially been certified malaria-free by the World Health Organization (WHO), becoming the first country in the Amazon region to eliminate the disease. This certification marks the successful interruption of indigenous malaria transmission for at least three consecutive years - a major step forward in the global fight against one of humanity's deadliest diseases.
title: Africa: Global Fund Commends Suriname's Elimination of Malaria

description: [Independent (Kampala)] Abuja -- Trade is set to expand at an average of 5.1 per cent a year through 2026, before quickening to 5.4 per cent by 2028
title: Africa: Africa's Trade Projected to Hit $1.5 Trillion in 2025

description: [Vanguard] Non-profit organisation, i-Scholar initiative, iSI, has urged African countries, especially Nigeria, to use foreign education as a catalyst for socio-economic growth.
title: Africa: Foreign Education Key to Africa's Socio-Economic Growth - Isi

description: [allAfrica]  Abduction of Ugandan MP Draws Opposition Criticisms
title: Africa: All of Africa Today - July 1, 2025

description: [World Bank] Families in rural Ethiopia are transforming their lives with clean energy. Supported by the World Bank's Ci-Dev, biogas digesters replace firewood, cutting smoke and improving crop yields. Off-grid solar brings light, boosts savings, and powers micro-enterprises. Since 2016, Ethiopia has earned $3.46 million in carbon credits, reinvesting in access and maintenance. For women like Abeba and farmers like Bohare, these solutions mean better health, income, and time. With microfinance and smart policies,
title: Africa: Saving Money, Breathing Easier - How Energy Access Is Transforming Lives in Ethiopia

description: [New Times] Prime Minister Edouard Ngirente has issued a rallying call for a continental shift toward nuclear energy, urging African nations to act collectively and decisively in a bid to close the continent's energy gap as demand surges with population growth.
title: Africa: Africa's Nuclear Moment? Rwanda Thinks So

description: [Nile Post] Ugandan music heavyweight Bebe Cool is gearing up to take East Africa by storm following the release of his latest album, Break the Chains.
title: East Africa: Bebe Cool Set to Take Over East Africa With New Album

description: [U.S. Mission to the UN] Jonathan Shrier
title: Africa: Remarks At the Informal Multistakeholder Hearing On Trafficking in Persons

description: [UN News] The UN's top rights official on Monday urged the international community to confront the growing human rights implications of climate change.
title: Africa: Human Rights Can Be a 'Strong Lever for Progress' in Climate Change, Says UN Rights Chief

description: [Afropop] June was hot; July might be even hotter! So here are seven new videos to savor. From Dayme's blues to Mádé Kuti's juggernaut groove, there's something here for everyone. Check out the full Afropop Top Videos playlist for all our recent selections. And remember, if you have suggestions of videos our fans would love, send them to info@afropop.org with the subject line "Top Videos 2025." Enjoy!
title: Africa: Afropop Top Videos - 7/1/25: Mádé Kuti, Daymé Arocena, Tekno and More!

description: [Afropop] Following the recent death of Garifuna music icon Aurelio Martinez, we naturally look to a younger generation for the pioneers of the future. One of those is Belizian Emilio Thomas, known artistically as Sásamu. Orit Novak recently worked with Sásamu in Belize. She interviewed Sásamu, co-produced a music video with him, and created a 33-minute film of their interview. Here is that video, and Orit's article on the experience for Afropop Worldwide.
title: Africa: The Now Is Ancestral - Garifuna Musician Sásamu in Conversation

description: [IPS] United Nations -- Tobacco kills up to half its users who don't quit, a grim reality that highlights the urgent mission of global tobacco control. A new report from the World Health Organization (WHO) reveals that while many countries have followed the organization's protocols to reduce tobacco use, major gaps still remain in broader implementation.
title: Africa: Global Tobacco Control Efforts Protect Up to 6.1 Billion People

description: [IPS] New York -- Dr. Heather Stobaugh is Associate Director of Research and Innovation, Action Against Hunger
title: Africa: When Life-Saving Treatment Disappears - the Coming Crisis in Child Malnutrition

description: [The Conversation Africa] Women are an important and often underutilised human resource in Africa. They've faced many problems historically. Limited access to land, finance, education and decision-making platforms have meant that women across Africa haven't been able to take part fully in the green economy.
title: Africa: African Women Are Key to Fighting Climate Change - These Are the Green Skills They Will Need
